newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Cairn Bangladesh gas workers rescued at sea.
newsitem.headline: Cairn Bangladesh gas workers rescued at sea.

text.p: Ten Bangladeshi workers with British Cairn Energy Plc, drilling for gas in the Bay of Bengal, were rescued after their boat sank at sea on Friday, a Cairn official said.
A helicopter from Cairn's drilling ship Ismaya rescued the victims, floating some 45 km (30 miles) from Kutubdia Island, after the boat capsized in rough weather while sailing to the rig.
"There was a clear weather warning against movement of small craft in the Bay because of a persisting monsoon depression. But the boat ignored it," one meteorology official said.
Cairn officials said all those travelling in the boat had been rescued. Only one of them suffered exhaustion from swimming, they said.
Cairn has been engaged in development drilling in Bangladesh's only offshore gas reserve, discovered by the company last year.
It expects to start commercial exploration of gas in April next year.
